revised_title: Glycolipid Synthesis in Animal Cells: Implications in Normal and Transformed States
tldr: The authors studied the synthesis of glycolipids in normal and transformed animal cells, focusing on the NIL 2 hamster line. They discovered that three larger glycolipids are absent in transformed lines, and their levels are lower in actively growing NIL 2 cells compared to contact-inhibited cells. This suggests that the lack of some glycolipids may be important in the depression of complex glycolipid synthesis in normal or transformed cells.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
